posts.post_text: August 31, 2017 at 12:51 PM#2One more,I'm looking for ways to stand by timecode generator at specific time.I manage to trigger timecode generator via macro; go, pause, off timecodeslot 1now I'm looking to stand by at specific time such pause at 1hr.What I'm trying to achieve*macro to change the clock window to view timecode slot 1 or 2*macro to stand by timecode slot 1 at 1hr*macro to go timecode slot 1 from 1h*macro to stand by timecode slot at 2hr*macro to go timecode slot 2 from 2hrthank youEDITThanks to Ryan I'm able to stand by my timecode slotTimecodeStatusThese are what can be found in [Setup] → {Timecode}Assign Root 3.6.x (or Root "Settings"."TimecodeStatus".xor Assign TimecodeSlot x) /Name /PreRoll /AfterRoll /GeneratorStartTime /GeneratorEndTime /GeneratorLooped /GeneratorTimeUnit /Infox = TimecodeSlot number or "name"/Name = "My Awesome Name"/PreRoll = 0.1s..1d3h46m40.00s - can also be input as raw seconds (i.e. 0.1..100000.00)/AfterRoll= 0.1s..1d3h46m40.00s - can also be input as raw seconds (i.e. 0.1..100000.00)/GeneratorStartTime = 0s..10d15h59m59.00s - can also be input as raw seconds (i.e. 0..921599)/GeneratorEndTime = 0s..10d15h59m59.00s - can also be input as raw seconds (i.e. 0..921599)/GeneratorLooped = off/on/GeneratorTimeUnit = "1/100 Seconds" / "30 FPS" / "25 FPS" / "24 FPS"/Info = "informative text here"Now, I only need to find out how to change the clock window to show between timer, clock, timecodeand view timecode 1,2,3,4, so on.
